newsitem.title: USA: P.S. Colorado acquisition to help earnings.
newsitem.headline: P.S. Colorado acquisition to help earnings.

text.p: Public Service Co of Colorado officials said on Monday a planned acquisition of a British utility would be accretive to earnings -- but not in the year a windfall tax applied.
Denver based Public Service and Ohio-based American Electric Power Co announced earlier they planned to buy Yorkshire Electricity Group Plc of Britain.
President and Chief Executive Officer Wayne Brunetti told a teleconference call the acquisition would be accretive to earnings "from the first year."
Public Service's Chief Financial Officer Dick Kelly said the acquisition would not help earnings the year the windfall tax applied, either in 1998 or 1999.
The acquisition is expected to be completed by mid-April.

Kelly said rate reductions are expected for Yorkshire in 2000 but it was not possible to predict the rate structure after that. He said Yorkshire expects to be treated as any regional electric company, despite the foreign ownership.
Brunetti said the board of Southwestern Public Service Co, with which Public Service intends to merge this spring, also approved the acquisition of Yorkshire.
